com.latencybusters.lbmct

Class LbmCtConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtConfig

  • public class LbmCtConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Container object holding configuration of an instance of LbmCt. The caller creates an config instance and sets desired options, and then passes it to LbmCt.start(com.latencybusters.lbm.LBMContext, com.latencybusters.lbmct.LbmCtConfig, java.nio.ByteBuffer).

    Note that the CT object retains a reference to the passed-in configuration object, so it is not recommended to modify options after the LbmCt is created, except for testing purposes. Also, if creating multiple CT objects, it is generally recommended to create separate configuration objects, one for each CT object (unless they all share exactly the same configuration).

    • Field Detail

      • TEST_BITS_DEBUG

        public static final int TEST_BITS_DEBUG
        Bit set in testBits to enable debug event logging. This bit controls the operation of dbg and debugQ. See Debugging for information on using this debugging feature. See setTestBits(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEST_BITS_NO_CREQ

        public static final int TEST_BITS_NO_CREQ
        Bit set in testBits to disable sending of CREQ handshake. This is to test retry logic. See setTestBits(int).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LbmCtConfig

        public LbmCtConfig()
        Constructor for LbmCt configuration object, initialized to default values. Use setters to override defaults.

    • Method Detail

      • setTestBits

        public void setTestBits(int testBits)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's test bits. See CT_CONFIG_DEFAULT_TEST_BITS.

        Parameters:
        testBits - Integer bit map of debug behaviors to enable. One or more of the following ORed together: TEST_BITS_DEBUG, TEST_BITS_NO_CREQ, TEST_BITS_NO_CRSP, TEST_BITS_NO_COK, TEST_BITS_NO_DREQ, TEST_BITS_NO_DRSP, TEST_BITS_NO_DOK.

      • setDomainId

        public void setDomainId(int domainId)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's Topic Resolution Domain ID. If not set (defaults to -1), the CT layer does not assume a domain ID, and will rely on the sending to sources feature. See Domain ID for more information.

        Parameters:
        domainId - Topic Resolution Domain ID.

      • setDelayCreq

        public void setDelayCreq(int delayCreq)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's delay before a receiver sends its the initial connection request handshake.

        Parameters:
        delayCreq - Time in milliseconds to delay.

      • setRetryIvl

        public void setRetryIvl(int retryIvl)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's time between handshake attempts. When a connected source and receiver are connecting or disconnecting, they exchange handshake messages to synchronize state. If a CT source or receiver sends a handshake and expects a response but does not get one within retryIvl milliseconds, the operation will be retried. See also setMaxTries(int).

        Parameters:
        retryIvl - Time in milliseconds to wait.

      • setMaxTries

        public void setMaxTries(int maxTries)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's number of tries. When a connected source and receiver are connecting or disconnecting, they exchange handshake messages to synchronize state. If a CT source or receiver sends a handshake and expects a response but does not get one within retryIvl milliseconds, the operation will be retried. After maxTries attempts, CT will give up, log an error, and stop retrying.

        Parameters:
        maxTries - Number of times to attempt handshakes.

      • setPreDelivery

        public void setPreDelivery(int preDelivery)
        Override the default value for the configuration object's received message pre-connected delivery behavior. Normally, a Connected Topics Receiver will not deliver messages received prior to a connection being established. Setting preDelivery to 1 enables the CT receiver to deliver messages received outside of the connected state. This can enable a CT receiver to get messages from a non-CT source, although this use case is not recommended. See .
        Parameters:
        preDelivery - 1=deliver messages outside of connection; 0=do not deliver.

      • getTestBits

        public int getTestBits()
        Gets the current value for the configuration object's test bits. This is important for cases where the user wants to set or clear an individual bit, leaving the rest of the bits undisturbed.
        Returns:
        Current value for test bits.

      • getDomainId

        public int getDomainId()
        Gets domain ID.
        Returns:
        Current domain ID.

      • getDelayCreq

        public int getDelayCreq()
        Gets delay, in milliseconds, before a receiver sends its the initial connection request handshake.
        Returns:
        Time in milliseconds to delay.

      • getRetryIvl

        public int getRetryIvl()
        Gets time, in milliseconds, between handshake attempts.
        Returns:
        Time in milliseconds between attempts.

      • getMaxTries

        public int getMaxTries()
        Gets maximum number of handshake attempts.
        Returns:
        Maximum number of attempts.

      • getPreDelivery

        public int getPreDelivery()
        Gets message delivery with non-connected sources.
        Returns:
        1=deliver messages outside of connection; 0=do not deliver.
